Reviews.Title: “A wee gem in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: champagneannie
Reviews.Content: We were a bit apprehensive about this hotel given some of the reviews. Yes it does not look like a great area on first impressions however this is only first impressions. Its really only an easy 10 minute walk to the beach and many lovely seafood restaurants. Once at the beach its only a short walk to Port Olympic and the lovely marina.We were only staying one night and have been to Barcelona a few times therefore it was nice to be away from the normal touristy areas. The rooms are spacious and similar to Premier Inn in the Uk, ie clean ,basic and modern. There are no amenities in the room ie no fridge, teamaking although you can upgrade to a superior room. The bar area is very small and doubles up as the hub for internet users. The bar staff are very helpful and friendly , they make great Mojitos and have cava and wine by the glass for just a few euros. We ate out at a great seafood restaurant across the main road from McDonalds.The breakfast was continental buffet ,plenty of pastries ,ham,cheese etc.The hotel is a good base for a short stay in Barcelona ,pre/post cruise or short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Near the beach”
Reviews.Author: GramsBarb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only a couple of blocks from the beach but is in a questionable neighborhood with not much around. It was a few blocks from the local metro stop which was the easiest way to get around. The rooms are small but clean and efficiently arranged. The bathroom was good sized but the shower had no door which resulted in water on the marble floor which became very slippery when wet. The heat/air was controlled and could not be changed. Luckily, there was a large window that opened to allow for cooling down the room. It seems many European hotels do not now include breakfast. This hotel had a breakfast buffet that was 18 euros (about $25 US). They had a special where you could get breakfast for only 9 euros but only if you signed up for your whole stay. The breakfast was just OK but not if you like cold eggs. There was a McDonald's about two blocks away for an alternative. The hotel staff was very accommodating. There was free internet access but believe it was dial up and not DSL it was so slow.

Reviews.Title: “If you like it hot”
Reviews.Author: Carol B Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for one night prior to a cruise. Further away than I thought from Port and Las Ramblas. Reasonable hotel, except that the air conditioning was only on hot and could not go to cold until end of April. This to me seemed stupid as I booked this hotel as it had air con as I like a cold bedroom. Even with the windows open all night the dial stayed at 28.5 degrees and therefore I could not sleep at all!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: bobbysueWairarapa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a "long" taxi ride from the airport - but it is convenient for embarking on a cruise ship. It is a short stroll to the beach and has a good bus service into the city.Most of the receptionists were very helpful and friendly, our room was extemely comfortable, and we enjoyed our tasty breakfast.Would definitely recommend this hotel for convenience, cleanliness and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Good Base to see Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Katie H
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights summer July 2010, found the hotel clean, great value for money and just a short walk to the beach. Its a good base to see Barcelona! Barcelona is a great city and theres lots to do and see. Bad points were our air con didn't work the first night and the room was 35oC, at the time i was 5 months pregnant and it was awful! After complaining we were moved rooms. Also theres no pool but its so close to the beach does it need one??

Reviews.Title: “great base to explore Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: BelgiumTravelBug
Reviews.Content: Hotel is out of the centre so you'll get a good rest at the end of the day, metro system is within walking distance and easy to use(get a 10 journey card is the cheapest) it is a city hotel so dont expect a balconey,swimming pool and sunbeds. Rooms wer comfy, modern with airco, great views form the window. The service was really good, some of the staffs english was not so good(but hey your in Spain) breakfast buffet was good and plentifl, just what is needed before setting out for the day and then as we got in we asked reception to turn on the steam romm and sauna which was a perfect way to relax after a long day walking round the many attractions of Barcelona. Would definately stay here again for a Barcelona City trip.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: GinaA
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and only returned yesterday. Its easy to find from the Llacuna metro station. Clean. That is about all the positives. Its rated a four star but with no minibar in the room? I had my purse stolen within first half in hour in Barcelona - on a train from the airport. A total disaster as you can imagine. I felt sick all of the first night, could not sleep, felt very hot (adrenaline and stress of being a victim of a robbery) so I called the reception at about 3 am asking them politely for some water. I was refused. Bar was closed apparently and that there were vending machines I can get some water from. Now with no money - as all was stolen from me - that was a bit difficult. I have explained and was told that they can't help me and if I am thirsty I should drink a tap water from the bathroom sink!!! Now that is not a 4 star hotel treatment! Furthermore, hotel had been infused in some sort of strange smell... also just next door to the cemetery. And the cost of breakfast - extreme! Euro 15 per person! or a more "affordable" Euro 9 if you take it every morning of your stay! Having asked to be given a one day discounted rate whilst we sort ourselves out after the robbery - they refused. We chose to go hungry over paying 30 Euros to gave a pastry and coffee each. Feel I have been robed twice - once on the train and second time by this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: robirob15
Reviews.Content: We have chosen the GBB 4 for our vacation for 3 nights and we had a great time there. It is not directly in the city center, still you can be at the metro station and the beach in 10 min by foot. The rooms were very nice, so I can definetly recommend to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Barcelona Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RoyandPenny
Reviews.Content: I wasn't really looking forward to staying, once again, in Barcelona because past hotel experiences there haven't been all that great. But, my wife and I were taking a transatlantic cruise from there and decided to "veg out" for a few days. After careful research, we chose GBB Hotel 4 for our stay from October 25-29, 2011. What a pleasure! Built in 2010 with all the amenities that one could hope for: excellent front desk service, modern elevators, FREE wi-fi, a clean fitness center with plenty of towels. The only drawback there was that one of the main pieces of equipment needed some TLC. Our room was fairly spacious (like one would find in the U.S.), and very clean. AC wasn't on because it seems that all of Europe thinks that once the calendar hits a particular day, there's no need for AC. That was OK, though. We always carry our trusty small fan. We chose to purchase their breakfast/dinner package. Again, excellent choice! Breakfast was plentiful; and dinner was a surprising experience from wine to dessert. The hotel is a bit away from the Las Ramblas area, but was OK with us because we had done that so many times. In its place was a view from our window which looked out over the cemetery to the Mediterranean which was only about three blocks away. Each day, my wife and I would walk to the sea and turn onto the walking path which skirted the sea and went for miles. Bottom line, the GBB Hotel 4, Barcelona was an excellent choice for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Charlie S
Reviews.Content: This place was great. The hotel is very modern and is only 10 minutes from the beach. The staff all spoke English and were very helpful. The breakfast buffet was a little pricey but it was very nice. We were able to get all over the city using the buses that stop just up the street. We loved Barcelona and when we go back we'll be sure to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice new hotel on the edge of town”
Reviews.Author: Karl013
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very modern and stylish and our room was well laid out and clean. We could open the bathroom window and look out to Sagrada Familia in the distance which was nice. The staff on reception were friendly and helpful as well. There is a metro stop about 5 minutes walk from the hotel, otherwise it would be a 30 minute (approximately) walk into the centre of town. In the opposite direction it is a 10 minute walk to the beach so it is very conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “A 5 star quality!”
Reviews.Author: Masyana
Reviews.Content: The rooms are comfortable and clean, the hotel is quite close to the metro Llacuna and the beach is 15 min walk away. Great, friendly English speaking (!!!) staff and lovely breakfast :) But: the rooms have no closet for clothes and in our bathroom there was no air ventilation or an air freshener.. Which turned out to be a little disturbing, when travelling with a guy :)))

Reviews.Title: “A good base”
Reviews.Author: freeicetea
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good base for visiting the city. As it is not directly in the centre the price is reasonable. We didnt have breakfast at the hotel because it was very expensive, instead we had breakfast wherever we headed for the day. The Blue line of the tourist bus stops around the corner and we used that as transport on the 2 days. In the even we used the metro. There is a station about 3 minutes walk from the hotel and we found it very convenient, cheap and easy to navigate. The staff were very helpful and answered any question we asked with plenty of clear information. The hotels negatives were the expensive breakfast I have mentioned, the beds are a little uncomfortable(firm) and the business feel of the hotel which lacks the romantic feel.

Reviews.Title: “Business orientated hotel in Barcelona suberbs...”
Reviews.Author: Joel P
Reviews.Content: This review if for the GBB Hotel 4 Barcelona, C/ Doctor Trueta, 164 08005 Barcelona. LOCATION: Firstly the hotel is about a 25 minute cab ride from the airport, secondly it’s located near the seafront in a mainly urban area, which is rather run down, there is nothing in the way of shops, bars or restaurants near by, you'll have to take a taxi into the town for that. (And on the subject of taxi's, I used several over the three days I was in Barcelona, and none of the taxi drivers knew where the hotel was! Thank goodness for sat-nav!) HOTEL The hotel itself is smart, clean and very business like in appearance, however, luxurious it isn’t, and I'll be honest I think the ‘4 stars’ rating is very optimistic. RECEPTION Reception is manned by friendly (mostly) English speaking staff. BUSINESS CENTRE The 'Business Centre' on the ground floor is a let down, two old HP pc's running Vista (and remember, its all in Spanish, including the keyboard layout) does not make a business centre, there are no fax or other facilities, just a some tables and chairs - more of an internet room. WI-FI The hotel does offer free wi-fi throughout, but be prepared to log back in as the system times you out regularly. HOTEL ROOMS The rooms themselves are spread 26 per floor over 7 floors, the views from the top floor of the seafront are very nice, but be aware, the hotel is situated in front of a very large cemetery! I booked a superior room, and it was large, well aired, with a very large and comfortable bed, good (if rather complicated) air-conditioning, but alas no bath, what is it with European hotels, showers are great but really, no bath, come on! And don't expect a mini-bar, or a fridge, or even tea and coffee making facilities, because there aren’t any, which seems rather stingy (for a 4 star hotel) to me. FOOD Food, a very limited menu, repeated each day, so not much in the way of variety there. A bizarre twist on the ‘room service’ offering, room service that’s only open between 8pm and 11pm, and overpriced, expect to pay twelve euros for a burger and chips. Breakfast was better, if a bit crowded, and only a two hour sitting so no time to dawdle! The usual 'continental' fare here, but perfectly edible. GYM On the lower ground floor is a well equipped gym, free to paying guests. PARKING There are also car parking spacing in a lower parking basement under the hotel for guests bringing cars. There are ‘on street’ spaces outside the hotel as well. SUMMERY To sum up, located too far from the centre of town and attractions to be a true tourist hotel, but also too far from the business area to appeal to business travellers. To under equipped for those 4 stars so I'm not quite sure what category this hotel falls into, and when I'm back in Barcelona I'll try somewhere else, not because the hotel wasn’t any good, it just wasn’t good enough, with too many annoying little things that add up to a stay that leaves you feeling like you could have had better…

Reviews.Title: “Oasis!”
Reviews.Author: fionapapa
Reviews.Content: Although situated a little distance from anything noteworthy, this hotel is easily accessible due to Barcelona's fabulous metro system and buses so we had absolutely no problem getting around. When we arrived, the staff were super-friendly and helpful. They even booked us the seats we wanted for a BarcelonaFC game at no commission to them! The room was spacious and the amenities in the bathroom were some of the best I've come across. Towels and linen were changed every day, although this could be limited due to environmental concerns. The breakfast was tasty but not worth the 15 euro it apparently costs (we didn't pay for the breakfast as we had booked a last-minute special deal which was the room and b'fast for under 60% of normal rates). All the breakfast consists of is a variety of pastries, cheeses, cold-cuts, fruit, boiled eggs and fritattas. As mentioned, tasty but could definitely be improved. The hotel staff are also very prompt. When our room safe broke down, they came within 20 minutes (on a Sunday morning) to repair it. The only thing I really didn't like was that their business centre doesn't have a printer. If you want to print out documents, you need to email them to the front desk and they print it out for you. In short, we would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Functional - but quite expensive”
Reviews.Author: bluejonny
Reviews.Content: the webiste highlights this hotel as being in "an up and coming area" and I guess in Estate agent speak, that means a bit of a hole. Upon arrival, if this is classified as up and coming I would hate to stay in a worse area!! Surrounded by run down, boarded or vandalised shops and apartments, this hotel sticks out as being in the wrong place. The hotel itself is average. For €118 a night, I got B&B, a basic room, a colour TV and a shower room. For another €25 per night you can get tea and coffee making facilities! Wow! The room was just about OK, cleanish. However, be warned if you don;t like hot hotels, avoid this one. The aircon does not work in the winter months as they switch it off - even though the temperatiure in my room according to the stat was 28 degrees!! "open the window" the reception staff suggest - but when you do the noise is bad from the surrounding roads, or the beautiful view of a petrol station. (yes I know the photo's show the sea, but three sides of the hotel look over classic sites - the block of run down apartments to the right, the run down street to the back, and the petrol station to the left) Walls and floors are typically paper thin - you can hear people shower, wash and pee. Not good. Other peoples TVs are clear through walls, people above you can hear tip toeing around... not good. No ironing board either, so instead a paid for, maid ironing service. But you do get wireless in the price. (but don't expect much from it) Breakfast is typical continental fayre, and to be fair everything was very good, even the coffee which is always a problem in hotels. Overall, it's somewhere I won't be returning to or recommeding. You can get better.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to explore Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Juledan
Reviews.Content: For a weekend trip we looked for a hotel in Barcelona. Usually this takes us about two hours, now it took us four days. With every hotel we looked at in booking.com, tripadvisor etc. something was wrong either the hotel was good but the price was too high or the price was good enough for us but the hotel had some issues like a bad neighbourhood, lousy staff, small rooms, no airco etc. In the end we almost wanted to give up when we found GBB hotel 4 hotel. The hotel is a little from the center but very close to the beach. While we didn't intent to have a beach holiday it did give us access on walking-distance to some very good nicely price seafood restaurants :-). The center of the city is easily accessible by the subway (about five to ten minutes walk) although if you intent to dine out a lot in the center be prepared to make use of taxi as the public transport closes early (between 23.00 and 23.30). The hotel itself is new and has a modern styling. All the staff members were very friendly. Room service is until 22.00 but in case you are very hungry you can walk in five minutes to McDonald’s in case that is of interest to you ;-). The hotel apparently offers a discount on the breakfast if you stay for more than three days. In that case you pay 9 euro per person instead of 14 euro’s. While better value breakfast might be available in some local bars around the hotel we decided to take the breakfast. It is above average hotel food. The restaurant area is ok compared to the size of the hotel but it can be busy between 09.00 and 10.00. It is possible to dine in the hotel. While we didn’t did it (the seafood restaurants at the beach were too good) many guests seemed to enjoy there dinner. The room was extremely clean and all the things you can expect are there except (mostly for British people?) perhaps the lack of tea and coffee making facilities. Also there is no mini-bar (we never use it anyway). There are vending machines for drinks on the 3rd and 7th floor where the drinks are very reasonable priced (1 euro for a bottle of water). If we have to nitpick perhaps two bathrobes should have been in the room for a four star hotel and the selection of tv-channels was not so interesting for us (about 15 channels mostly German, Spanish and some English). We have to mention the bed and pillows separately: they were most comfortable about the best we have experienced in a hotel. Note: it is possible to have a mini-bar, bathrobes, tea and coffee making facilities but the you either have to ‘upgrade’ your room when you check in or book a superior room in the first place. We had some trouble with the airco and the hotel staff tried to fix it but it was of no use. It remained warm (23-24 degrees) the whole time. Maybe because we visited after summer the airco can only warm the air? (like you sometimes see in other hotels). Note 2: The taxi ride from and to the hotel is about 30 – 40 euro’s. During the day there are plenty of taxi’s outside the hotel so there is no need to make reservations. All in all we had a really good time in lovely Barcelona partly thanks to this hotel :-).

Reviews.Title: “A Great Time!!!”
Reviews.Author: girldoc67
Reviews.Content: Great room. Quiet atmosphere, as we were seriously jet lagged on our first night and really appreciated the quiet. No complaints about my loud bf and I preparing to go out to Port Olimpic with our house music. Friendly, accomodating staff. Great location we walked to the beach a couple of times. Also within walking distance from a Barcelona Turistic stop, the city's double decker tour bus. I would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “good, modern hotel, away from the centre”
Reviews.Author: dominicp
Reviews.Content: The nearest metro station, llacuna is 5-10 mins walk away and the area on this side of the hotel is shabby. The area on the seafront side of the hotel is much nicer. The room was quite large, the bathroom was clean and modern, the shower was superb. the strange thing was the bathroom door which was made of glass and would not stay closed. Also the trendy square sink didnt drain properly. The bed was firm and comfortable. The room was fairly quiet but it was hot because the aircon didnt cool the room properly. Breakfast is 9 euros, so we skipped it. There are cafes nearby. The walk to the sea front from the hotel is through a park. there are plenty of resturants on the sea front about 15-20mins walk away. On the other side of the hotel is an area called poblenou which also has some good restaurants that are more typically spanish, and small supermarkets. The best way to travel to the city centre is by bus - there are several stops nearby. The buses in barcelona are excellent. All in all its a reasonable location, but a little expensive. Overall i would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location and a confusion of prices.”
Reviews.Author: Alan C
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is excellent for the city and the beach. It is five minutes walk to the Metro stop of Llacuna, which will take you to the major sightseeing areas within fifteen minutes, and five minutes from the excellent beach that has all the facilities one could wish for. The number 14 bus that stops two minutes from the hotel will take you the scenic route to Las Ramblas and on. The hotel itself is very clean, comfortable and the rooms large enough for a week’s stay. It would appear to be business orientated in view of the emphasised facilities and the lack of actual cupboard space, just the open shelves, which my wife and I do not like. However, that is purely a personal opinion, as we like some privacy for our belongings and protection for clothing that can get dusty. The breakfast is what one would wish, except that the hot food was warm. This was a pity as the tortilla and the bacon would have been excellent. There is free internet access, which is a bonus, and wi-fi throughout the hotel. The staff are very welcoming, polite and helpful, even to printing off our boarding passes for the flight home free of charge. We had a small problem with our shower the first day that was settled within half an hour. We did not eat in the restaurant, but the menu looked very acceptable and not overpriced. What is confusing is the variation in the prices for rooms and breakfast. The room we had was around €200 a night, yet because we stayed for six days the price was based on three different rates, the average of which was what we paid - around €66 per night. We could not have calculated that prior to booking and we were very pleasantly surprised, but a little confused. Also the breakfast at the quoted price of €15 was very high, but if you stay for more than a certain number of nights it drops to €9, which is good value. Again, we have no complaints whatsoever, but it does show that it is possibly more business-person orientated, although most of the guests were there for only two or three nights with one coach party there for nearly a week. There are some excellent eateries nearby, especially on the seafront. Cafés abound if you wish to eat breakfast out of the hotel. If you like fish, it is piscatorial heaven. The best places we found were both Monchos. The first, on the right along the beach from behind the hotel where the a-la-carte covers most tastes - try the freshly fried whitebait - and then there is our favourite, ‘Vitamins of the Sea’ at Port Olympic, another few minutes along the beach, where a fantastic set meal for around €13.80 is enormous and even the locals could not do it justice. There is a tapas-type starter and salad that are not just tasters, but large enough individual dishes to almost constitute a whole meal on their own. Then the Paella that would feed the 5000, followed by a thankfully simple, but very tasty Crème brûlée and a small coffee. On top of all that, a drink was included. The other area to eat, away from the beach, is the Rambla del Poblenou, again just five minutes walk away. Here you can find a good mix of restaurants from the burger-joint to quite pricey restaurants. For a good, cheap and filling meal, around €8, try the Lebanese ‘Arwad’.- the basmati rice is delicious. For something more traditional and more expensive there is no better place than ‘La Broqueta’. My wife had half a large rabbit and I had steak, both of which were very tasty and cooked to perfection. Do look at menus as all the restaurant fronts look much the same, but do not be put off by what appears to be a small café because it may conceal a diner’s paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, conveniently located - close to the sea”
Reviews.Author: Nikolay57
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, conveniently located - close to the sea and also on walking distance from the subway. Rooms are comfortable, there is an underground parking lot, but you can park the car in the street for free.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: tess b
Reviews.Content: me and a friend of mine stayed in this hotel! we loved it! super close to the beach of Bogatell (my preferred beach in Barna!) and close to the metro (so within the city in minutes!). the staff is really kind and helpfull! spacious rooms and breakfast is fine.... and what we enjoyed the most was the sauna and the turkish bath, with relaxing coloured lights! defenitely a great choice of hotel if you are visiting barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Close to beach”
Reviews.Author: candym
Reviews.Content: Great price, location and rooms. Walking distance to the beach. Breakfast was good but very crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Saman1980
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in this great hotel , it is a new and modern one. The rooms are clean and tidy , the room service is good. there is no refrigerator in the room. It is 5 minute walk to the beach , there is a McDonald's and a Bus Touristic Station in the way to the beach , and the beach is very very clean and of high standards. just in the right side of the beach is a port that has good restaurants. About 10 minute walk in the opposite direction of the beach you will reach to metro station that connects you to whatever attractions is in Barcelona. The hotel can manage the reservation and discount for most of the attractions for you. There is free internet wireless access in the rooms but there are two computer terminals for accessing internet in the Lobby too. The breakfast is good but I expected more from a 4 star hotel. I did not feel any downside for this hotel and absolutely recommend this value for money hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I reallike the hotel and would return there”
Reviews.Author: zaugol
Reviews.Content: I've decided to book this hotel after few cancelations from other hotels. And it was good decision. We really enjoyed the hotel. It is very close to sea (about 5 min walk) and hotel itself is new and nice. It is few blocks away from metro so if you want to explore the city I would advise you to use metro. Restaurant at the hotel is good so if the weather is not that good to go out you can enjoy your meal there. It is nice and quite. People at reception were helpful. WIFI wasn't the best but that is ok, so I didn't send to much time working enjoying my vacation. We've stayed there for 10 days and I would say that this was the best vacation for last few years. Taxi from airport will cost you about 40 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely new hotel close to the beach”
Reviews.Author: Andycap_9
Reviews.Content: This was a very friendly hotel. Reception staff could not have been better. The hotel is only one year young and very modern. Rooms are very clean and comfortable.Internet is available in a separate lobby lounge. The hotel also provides beach towels, on a ten euro refundable deposit,for hotel guests. This is very handy.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean value for money”
Reviews.Author: Nigee65
Reviews.Content: We had a 4 night summer break at this hotel. It proved to be in a good location in respect of the beech, beech bars and restaurants, (5 mins walk). The beach is very clean and well serviced bins etc. The Hotel was very clean and eficient, we diddn't have breakfast lots of alternatives. You need to ask for one of the larger rooms. Ask reception to check them out before you move in, some of the rooms are SMALL. Rooms are clean bathrooms are good, beds are a little hard. The hotel is about a mile from the main part of City, 5 mins by taxi about 6 euros all black and yellow Taxi's are metered. Go to the Marina some nice bars and restaurants. The old town is 10 mins walk from the Marina. In the old town BE WARNED! pick pocketing is rife do not let any one get in your face, or touch you at all!! They will distract you and steal anything they can get. Having said that it is lovely and we had a great break. Hotel did what it said on the lable and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, dissapointing treatment”
Reviews.Author: stikis
Reviews.Content: Dispite the fact that GBB is a very nice and very clean hotel i have to say that i was totally diassapointed of the way they treat us in a very unexpectable situation.. 5 a.m and i came back to the hotel pretty tired and unlikely i see that the door of my room wouldn't open.. I had to go down to the reception and up to my room again 4 times.. The result was that the door couldnt open and the receptionist asked me to wake up my girlfriend who was sleeping inside in order to open the door from inside. I really wonder what would have happened if nobody was in the room.. The next day i found a little note under my door which said that we had to let them know when we are leaving the room so they could check the locker from the inside.. I call the reception and they told me i have to switch rooms.. it was 3:30p.m i had to be somewhere at 5p.m and i couldnt be late.. I said that that i had to pack all my clothes and i would run out of time but the answer of the receptionist was "dont worry i'll here until 11p.m you can do it whenever u want" . The obvious problem was that i had to go and i mentioned it once again in order to get the best answer ever... "you can leave your room if you want but we cant guarrante that the door will open!!!!!" We switched rooms as fast as possible, they didnt even send a guy to help us with our luggage and ofcourse i was late on my work..i expected to have a special treatment (like 1 day refund) for the inconvenience or at least to send someone to help us since the mistake wasn't ours and it was so inresponsible of their behalf not to have allternative way to open the door of a room..

Reviews.Title: “too secluded”
Reviews.Author: sterling60898
Reviews.Content: the hotel is nice (a bit small compared to standard American hotels), but the hotel is far away from all the tourist attractions. the purpose of my trip was to see the city, but the hotel is practically located in the middle of nowhere. and being unfamiliar with the city, it was uncomfortable that the hotel was so secluded from the center. also, when you first arrive at the hotel, the staff will recommend a restaurant (i've seen the same guy recommend the same restaurant over and over again). do not go there unless you are willing to pay a fortune for just average food. overall, the hotel was okay, but i felt that my experience in barcelona could have been enhanced had the hotel been in a better location

Reviews.Title: “Good address”
Reviews.Author: Domi99
Reviews.Content: We passed a very good stay in this hotel in the beginning of June, 2011. Situated well hotel (10mn on foot of the subway), in the peace, far from the tumult of the life from Barcelona and close to beaches accessible on foot). Spacious bedroom and respect for our request of marital bed. A point to improve, in the breakfast, the room is too small, infringe in the self-service restaurant coffee, buffet and sometimes missing products . We have the tested the dinner which is of a good value for money. Good address and thus advising.

Reviews.Title: “No Nonsense Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sauter
Reviews.Content: GBB Hotel 4 is a clean new hotel located in a peaceful neighborhood. Internet was free but it took us quite sometime to get connected. The staffs were pretty friendly. There were some amenities like iron that was not provided in the room, but other than that we were quite happy with overall service. The breakfast array provided enough choices and the coffee was good enough. No complaints at all. The room was small but comfortable. Nicely lit and air-conditioned. Being new definitely has an advantage. It was quite a walking distance to Llacuna Metro Station. For someone who's walking alone at night it might be intimidating since the neighborhood was really quiet. There were a few pubs and restaurants along the way, but for some reasons we didn't really see them open. Perhaps we passed when they weren't open. There was a bus stop conveniently located across the street, and the bus route can be easily found on the pole. If you know where you're going that's also an easy option.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near the beach!”
Reviews.Author: Cruiser09Canada
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the GBB Hotel 4 for 5 days prior to our Carnival cruise. The hotel is located very close to the beach and within walking distance to the metro (about a 5 minute walk to each). It was a great location away from the hustle and bustle of Las Ramblas. The customer service was excellent. Rooms are very clean. Bed was a bit too firm and the walls are pretty thin. Key card does not work all the time and the network access is very slow. There are 2 computers available for use. There are no ice machines available. Overall, a great hotel. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice and relaxing stay in this modern hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sideburnsdave
Reviews.Content: Stylish, modern hotel in a great location. Only 5 mins walk to both the beach and the metro. You could have a nice and steady walk along the boardwalk on the sea front to the city in about 1 hour.The local area was interesting including several authentic bars and restaurants and also a large cemetry. The staff at the hotel were really helpful and small things like giving you beach towells were appreciated. Our room was large and clean. The only negative i can say was that the breakfast room could have been bigger.

Reviews.Title: “Beware when dealing with this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: frances038
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed at this hotel and I used my credit card for guarantee purposes only as I made the booking. At the end of our stay we all settled our accounts individually. A month later on my bank statement the hotel had actually deducted the whole amount for everyones stay on our arrival and credited it back 4 days later. They have failed to understand the way they did the transaction the bank classed it as a withdrawal and I was charged a £40.00 USE fee. The hotel accounts department have been most reluctant to look into this and the only explanation the hotel has given via e-mail is something about the exchange rate which makes no sense whatsoever. I have stayed in many many hotels for a number of years now and this has never happened to me before. Any potential guests take note.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great Location, near the Beach and city center within 5 minutes by metro!”
Reviews.Author: Ben2001
Reviews.Content: After a short flight we arrived at the hotel early in the morning, since normal check in time is 14:00 hours we expected to have to wait for a couple of hours. However the staff welcomed us very friendly and we were able to check in immediatly. How Wonderfull to take a shower after a flight and head off directly to the beach!! From the hotel it takes a five minute walk to get to the beach which is great with all kinds of facilities. Showers, separate bathrooms and a couple of nice facilitys to go for a quick bite are available at the beach. The hotel is located in the suburbs of Barcelona but in a quiet neighbourhood which is safe to walk in during the nights. The metro station to get to the city center is within five minutes of walking distance. The port, were everybody should definitely go, is within 15 minutes of walking. There are some great restaurants some of them are kind off expensive but its worth a visit! Especially the Carpe Diem Lounge Club. make sure you take enough money because it's expensive. A Cocktail round € 12.00 Starter € 10.00, Main Course € 25.00 Dessert € 14.00. But it's definitely worth every euro! IIn the hotel the staff is very friendly and helpfull, the rooms are great. ask for a room on the highest floor, with sea view! Great views from the room. The hotel is supplied with a fitness, Small Spa, free internet in the rooms (Pretty fast!) unfortunately there is no minibar to keep your drinks cool.

Reviews.Title: “excellent, friendly, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: allison089
Reviews.Content: hotel staff were friendly, rooms were very clean and spacious the only problem we had with hotel was breakfast the next morning. there was not enough seating in breakfast room so we were asked to go down stairs to eat breakfast by the time we got down stairs food was cold !!! overall the breakfast that was offered was very good for 9 euro. so if you are going for breakfast stay in breakfast room until a table becomes available.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice four star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: maat1n
Reviews.Content: We were there last year in june and it was nice. The rooms are big enough and spotless all the time. Cleaness was at very high level. Unfortunately there was no balcony. It was very quiet , but that is no wonder, knowing the hotel is situated next to the graveyard. Breakfast was very good, staff very friendly. It is not in the city center, but that wasn't a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Friendly Staff and loved the location!”
Reviews.Author: MrsPol
Reviews.Content: Really nice clean and modern hotel which we thought was great value for money! We were really pleased with the location. It was an easy 5 minute walk to a very nice beach area, and easy access to the metro and taxis for getting into the Town Center. While we were staying at the hotel, the staff took really good care of us and attended to an issue we had with minimum fuss and maximum efficiency. If I were heading to Barcelona any time soon, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal service, great location, great value, average rooms.”
Reviews.Author: kballtraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the GBB Hotel 4 for 4 nights. I could not have been more pleased with my choice and the overall experience! Before selecting a hotel, I read hundreds of reviews and looked for a well priced option with good reviews that would allow two women (my cousin and I) traveling alone to feel safe. I'd literally read reviews from other locations that said they were mugged in the lobby and stuff had been stolen out of their locked safes. Crazy! We found exactly what we were looking for and much more at the GBB Hotel 4! Security & Safety: We felt very safe in the neighborhood and the hotel had a security guard in the late hours. The in room safe was easy to use and while we had a few problems with it, probably 1 of only a few faulty safes in the entire hotel, I was thoroughly impressed with the staffs response! The safes batteries died twice during our 2 day stay and when we were ready to leave and lock up our stuff, the hotel didn't have anymore on hand to replace the batteries. Apparently only 2 people at the hotel had the access or knowledge to fix it or activate the emergency override. I was extremely pleased that they didn't pass out the code to more staff. As an alternative, the hotel staff locked our computer and passports up in the hotel office. On the second occassion, when we needed them to use the emergency override, the manager came to access the safe and brought us a free bottle of wine for our troubles. Service: The staff were excellent! They were incredibly helpful! They organized a rental car for us, brought us wine when we had a problem, gave us directions and offered suggestions. Could not have been more pleased with the staff! Location: Incredibly convenient to the metro and incredibly convenient to the Center City. Literally, a 5 min walk and a 7-10 minute ride to Jaume I just outside the Gothic Quarter. The beach was much closer than we thought, max a 6 minute walk. The Bus Touristic picks up 2 minutes around the corner which was incredibly convenient. And, there's an incredible local restaurant between the hotel and the metro. By far, the best meal we had on our trip! Value: We booked over 1 month out, online through the hotel and got a great deal. I loved the free wifi, which was easy to use. The breakfast was delicious, although the dining area was quite full and I wouldn't pay full price for it. (We didn't pay full price though and never have to wait for a table though.) Recommendations for improvement/cons: The rooms were sparse and a bit smaller than an American is used to. Ours consisted of 2 twin beds, a desk, a side chair, night stands, telephone and a flat screen tv. Very clean and modern, but nothing special and no "wow" factor. There wasn't a clock. They really should buy clocks. The safe was on one of the shelves in the closet, again very easy to use but didn't come with directions so I had to ask the front desk. They could easily print out and laminate a directions card. The beds were a tad hard, but probably typical of a Spanish hotel. The pillows weren't as soft/large/nice as I'd like, were I focused on sleeping in. Additionally, there were only 2 bath towels. Being a women with long hair, I like to have a second towel. Then again, we didn't bother to ask for extras. And, the toiletries weren't replaced as we used them. If the soaps gone, I'd like more. However, there were a lot more toiletries than I'd typically expect, e.g. they included a toothbrush. Finally, they charged 5 Euro for the fitness room/spa (sauna) which I thought was rather silly. And, the sauna closed at 9 pm. If they didn't charge for it, they wouldn't need a dedicated staffer to sit there and collect the money, therefore being able to keep it open later. It did look clean though. I recognize that many of these are very nitpicky things, but important to consider depending on the type of vacation you're planning. In conclusion, we had a great time in Barcelona and were incredibly happy that we choose the Hotel GBB 4. While the rooms lacked the "wow" factor that one might normally get at a 4 star hotel, I'd strongly recommend this hotel for anyone that didn't intend to spend their vacation in their hotel room!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - perfect for a reserved romantic summer break”
Reviews.Author: ajalexjackson
Reviews.Content: Never has a hotel compelled me to actually get on the internet and write a review. Without sounding hysterical, it was fabulous! A great find, perfect for a romantic break, in a great location for a quiet break. The hotel itself is smart and modern, with exceptionally clean rooms. The bathroom was spotless, with a modern, spacious shower and very linear basin. The facilities are not plentiful, however, what they have is delivered to the highest standard. The business centre is a nice size, with free internet access and the restaurant and room service were absolutely top quality for the pretty meagre prices charged. A sidenote here, is the quick, late night meal I decided to order after not getting a great meal out in town. I decided on a hamburger with potato wedges and onion rings for a light bite and for 12e didn't expect a huge deal. But 10 minutes later came up what can only be desribed as a gourmet burger, which melted in the mouth. So much so, my partner, who minutes earlier had refused a snack, decided that she would now like one too! I have seen reviews here that have mentioned the staff being rude - I cannot say this is something we encountered. In fact, our experience was quite the opposite. The staff were very friendly, understanding with our lack of linguistic prowess (we both speak no Spanish, at all) and were generally very helpful. In fact, they enhusiastically helped to translate where needed and pointed us in the right direction on a few occasions. In conclusion, I'd recommend this hotel to couples, who like romantic walks down the beach (there are some lovely restaurants and bars, including Inercia Beach Bar, which was very good). It is in a location where you are not in the thick of things, however, with relatively short walk (beach area, Gran Casino, Barceloneta, Diagonal Mar) or approx 7-10e taxi trip (zoo, aquarium, parks, restaurants, la ramblas) it is in a location where things are quite cheap to get to. Also, the Barcelona Bus Turistic passes in the street adjacent to the hotel. So for 30e for two days you can hop on/off 3 mapped routes and see the sites such as the Camp Nou, which is breathtaking for any football fan, the Segunda Famillia etc, so the sites are in reach, and makes this hotel even more attractive for the culture vultures. Already planning to go back next year with friends - as we would love to show off the area, the city and the hotel, which quite frankly for the price, is an absolute steal! I have stayed in worse hotels for much more £££.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice, value for money.”
Reviews.Author: dkak
Reviews.Content: The double room on the 7th floor was relatively large, very clean and with a nice look. Bathroom was also large and with extremely hot high-pressured water. The prices of the mini bar were very rational but lacked in alcohol. The reception service was always good and helpful. The location was very close to llacuna metro station (25 min from Catalunya station with one line change) and to Barceloneta beach. The bús turistic has also stop nearby.

Reviews.Title: “a positive surprise! highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Duquesa71
Reviews.Content: as we were headed towards barcelona we booked the hotel for its price without being so convinced about the location at first ..well.. we were soooooo positively surprised to see how close it is to everything would it be walking ( the beach and the rambla poblenou), by bus, or even by tube .. on the top of it the rooms are perfectly fitted with a good maintenance and an effective housekeeping service ..The staff is very friendly and helpful .. we were travelling with our little one who can be difficult at times and their friendliness really helped to make our stay one of the most enjoyable to discover this amazing city .. on the whole .. a nice 4 star that does not try to act as a 5 star .. a very good value for money .. we will go there again and again;-)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location, would return!!”
Reviews.Author: Georginah766
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel was good, to be honest we didnt use any other facilities within the hotel but all staff were friendly and helped when ever we asked them anything. The hotel room was excellent, very very clean, great size, the bed was huge and comfy, the bathroom was excellent and cleaned to a fantastic standard each day. This hotel is about 6/7 min walk from the metro link and in an area that felt very safe, 8 - 10 min walk to the beach, I would return to this hotel on my own with my children as it felt so safe, it is a 2/3 min tube journey out of the centre, the room was well sound proofed and we got a great nights sleep in this hotel, we stayed for 3 nights and found it to be great value for money and for us we didnt mind a few mins walk each morning a great location. Very modern decor throughout. It was my boyfriends Birthday while we were away and the staff very kindly put a free bottle of wine and Birthday card in the room and this was a lovely touch for us. While in Barcelona we found it to be a perfect city but please be aware of the pic pockets, we did see one person get moeny taken while on the tube, just common sense approach dont have a back pack on and be a little cautious while in large crowds. We did have 2 small beers while on the Ramblas and got charged 13 euros for this, so ask for the price first or go on one of the side street bars. Overall a fantastic experience I would return to Barcelona and would definatley use this hotel again. I honestly dont have anything negative to say about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: gar200
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with our choice of this hotel. Read all the reviews and the comments about the hotel being in the middle of nowhere with nothing around, although a little true, its location is good. its a quiet residential area and every block has a traditional coffee shop or tiny shop giving good value for money and the local experience. Room was large enough, would have liked a bath and shower, but the shower was good. Nice side view to the beach too and the beautiful Poblenou cemetery (worth a walk round!). its a short 3 block walk to Llacuna metro and 15mins into the city on the metro so very convenient. Its only 5 min walk to a nice beach with a few bars/restaurants and only 15min walk along the prom to the marina with lots of restaurants, tho if you stay off the prom, you'll encounter cheaper local places to eat. So if you want a good standard hotel and not fussed about being out of the bustle of the main city and like the local experience this is perfect. The restaurant just up the street is amazing. we had a fab meal here. I have only a couple of minor grumbles... the wireless was hit and miss in the room but fine downstairs and the hotel will lend you a cable to plug laptop in. I would expect a 4 star hotel to have tea/coffee facility in the room, its nice sometimes to make a cuppa when you want it. The aircon was a bit temperamental, dont think it was really working, tho we only tried to use it once, it wasn't reported. Value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel for a great price”
Reviews.Author: Gemzy_Wemzy
Reviews.Content: We've just got back from this hotel and have not got a bad thing to say about it really. Having read a few mixed reviews before we went we were not sure about what to expect. All in all it cost use £120 for two nights, which for a 4* hotel in Barcelona is rather cheap. Check In- Said on the reservation sheet from 3pm onwards. We arrived at about 1:30pm thinking we'd have to hang around a bit. No problems, checked in quickly and painlessly by a very friendly member of staff. Room- Exceptionally clean and well presented. Bathroom in ours was a wet room and was very nice. Very heavy blackout curtain meant that no light got into the room so a good night's sleep (only problem being that the blackness is so thick that if you wake up middle of the night you won't see anything). The TV is nice (only English channels being the news ones) but when you go away you don't go to watch TV. Free Wi-Fi is fantastic. Restaurant/Food- We didn't have breakfast so can't really comment on that aspect. We did, however eat in their for our evening meal on one night. The food was excellent and we were well catered for. It was very quiet so the waiter seemed a bit bored and spent a lot of time with other staff in the kitchen but he seemed more than helpful when asked for something. Cafe in the hotel is a tad overpriced for the quality of the coffee (maybe because we found a gorgeous cheap cafe by Tredeaguer metro station the day before). Location- Really close to Llacuna metro station, literally straight walk up the road. We bought a T-10 metro card for 8.25 euros which covered our transfer from/to airport and all the journeys we wanted on the metro while we were there. If you have to transfer lines it doesn't charge twice, as long as you take the trip within 1 hour and don't leave the metro system. The Renefe train drops you off at Passeg de Gracia and you just transfer to yellow L4 to get to Llacuna station. It really is simple. This is much cheaper than getting a taxi or shuttle bus. The hotel itself is outside of the main centre in the business district and after reading reviews I was led to believe it was too far. On our first day we decided to walk to the beach (a very short walk from the hotel) and walk down the front to Port Olimpic. We then decided to walk a bit further and before we knew it we were at Port Vell and into the main centre. It must have taken us about 20-30 mins to walk from the hotel to Barcelona Catedral which is not that bad if you like walking. For those lazy people among us the metro links to Jaume I station in about 5 minutes. Staff- No complaints, really friendly and willing to do anything for you. In general I loved this hotel and will definately visit again next time I go to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: JB27UKTraveller
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading mainly positive review on this site, and was not disappointed - it provided a good value base for a long weekend in Barcelona. The hotel is clean and modern, close to the Llacuna Metro station and the beach. The surrounding area is quiet. I was on the 6th floor, and could hear no noise at night. The heavy blackout curtain guaranteed a good night's sleep. The room (twin) was clean, if slightly sparse. No minibar (if only to chill my own drinks), and no iron in the room, and none to borrow from reception. Complimentary wifi was a good point too. I did not eat any meals in the hotel so cannot comment on the catering, nor did I use the sauna/gym facilities. My taxi driver did not know where this hotel was, so the journey was long and very expensive, so here's a tip to anyone planning to travel to the hotel from the airport - buy a T10 ticket (about €9), which covers 10 journeys on the metro, and a trip on the airport train is included in the price. The metro is great, frequent and clean, so it's a good buy.

Reviews.Title: “good clean modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: MidlandsMollydog11
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from this hotel, which was a quite new hotel. The room was clean and comfortable and we found we slept well most nights. We had breakfast at the hotel which was also good and plentiful. The room was cleaned well each day and the staff in the hotel were all helpful when asked any questions. The area around the hotel was perhaps not the best (a bit run down) but it was a short walk down to the beach and then along the coast to Port Olympic to find plenty of bars to eat in the evening. Transport into all areas of Barcelona was also easy. There was a metro station nearby with only 4 stops to the centre, and a No.14 bus stopped just near the Hotel and went to the top of La Rambla. Also perhaps best of all the Bus Turistic stopped near the hotel and is to be recommended for a 'hop on hop off'' trip around Barcelona, a great way to see the City.

Reviews.Title: “PANTS”
Reviews.Author: Lofty_p
Reviews.Content: Poorly equipped – no irons, no coat hangers, cheap and nasty beds; Not enough staff; Unfriendly staff; Very poor location - in middle of residential area with smelly drains; Taxis are very rare and taxi drivers don’t know of it; Food very poor. Very slow internet - locals must be camping on it; Just don’t go there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Barcelona - Hotel Gbb 4”
Reviews.Author: LaurieRushden
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent - very clean comfortable and with ample secure parking, albeit at a charge of 15 Euros. It is not the most attractive or central area of Barcelona, but seemed safe. The staff were friendly, spoke English and went the extra mile to help. Great location to explore Barcelona as it is near the Metro and a walk away from the Olympic Port. Reasonbly priced restaurants a short walk away. Didn't have breakfst so can't comment.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel with unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Yodagryp
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located outside of the citycenter in a quiet neighbourhood. Its close to the olympic harbor where especially in the evenings its nice to walk by the beach and enjoy one of the many restaurants. Like I said the hotle is indeed located outside of the citycenter, but the hart of barcelona is closeby thanks to the wonderful public transport. The metro is only a 5 minute walk from the hotel and just opposide the hotel a bus to plaza catalunya stops every 20 minutes. The hotel is very modern, with a loungy style and very clean. The bedrooms are beautiful, decorated with wonderful paintings of barcelona and a very decent bed. We stayed at the 6the floor and had a breathtaking view over the city. We saw the port, montjuic and the sagrada familia. Especially at night with all the lights it was just amazing. The only bad thing I can say about this hotel is that their staff is just rude. At check inn we encountered a reception lady who was very unfriendly. When we asked questions about breakfast and early checkout (we needed to catch our plain) we were answered in a very rude way. At the breakfast buffet the twe stafmembers where talking to eachother and did not greet the gast entering the restaurant. We did not get any explanation about where to get coffee. Together with another guest we searched for the coffeemachine and how to use it. After that we spend 15 minutes trying to get some toast. The toastmachine was turned of and we did not get it to work. After 15 minutes we just gave up.... All this time the two staffmembers stood against te wall looking at us and the other guests with the same problem. Its a ashame such a lovely hotel has such unfriendly unwelcoming staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic 4 Night stay in GBB Hotel 4 Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Paul_JGlasgow
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent four nights at this fantastic hotel. It was a surprise christmas present for her. I booked early to receive the Early booking rate and was surprised at finding a hotel with such good value in Barcelona with such good service! We arrived around 11pm due to a delayed flight and the recpetionist greeted us warmly and checked us in, giving us all the information we needed. There are two or three lifts in the hotel to get to the various floors. Rooms are on floors 1 -7, Restaurant is on Floor 1, Reception and Bar on ground. Floor -1 is the gym /sauna/toilets. When we headed up to our room it was modern and bright. It was one fo the "smaller" rooms in the hotel but not too small. All modern things in the room - Safe that you pick the code for, 26" flat screen with 3 or 4 english channels, plenty of spanish, german and french channels too. Bathroom was sparkling - looked like it had just been plumbed in the day before. Maid service came in every day, changed towels twice during our 4 day stay. Free box of disposable shavers / shampoo / tissues was a nice touch also. There is a hairdryer in the bathroom also - one of those "screwed to the wall" variety. Was useful to have to lighten the suitcases =]. Very comfortable bed in the room, and lots of cupboard space for hanging clothes and such. The view was good also. (See pictures) In the summer it would be very bright and would provide lovely views of the sea and over all of the city of Barcelona. The restaurant was the only thing that slightly lowered the rating of the hotel. The menu is quite limited and expensive for what it is - although it's still worth a try. We never tried breakfast in the hotel - we just got it out in Barcelona. - The location of the hotel is fantastic for getting to the beach - out the door then a five minute walk to golden sand. (Sadly the walk is past a McDonalds) For getting to the city centre the hotel is 3 blocks (roughly 10 mins) walk from the Llacuna metro station. This takes 10 mins to get to the city centre (Passieg de Gracia). Over the four nights there were a number of different front desk staff on duty and i must have asked each one a different question and all were more than happy to assist me, with maps and information about how to find a place in barcelona, they also kept our suitcases on the last day after checkout as we had a late flight from the airport. All in all - very happy with this hotel, it's staff, and would definetly return here if staying in Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel near the beach”
Reviews.Author: Jenda2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite new, rooms are nice and well equipped. The reception had no problem to check us in at 11:00 already and were very friendly. There is not much in the neighbourhood but it is few metro stops to the center and 5 minutes on foot to the beach. The breakfast is fine, just avoid crowds at 9:30 :-)

Reviews.Title: “great location; great accommodations”
Reviews.Author: kickitgirl67
Reviews.Content: my bf selected this hotel from an internet site based on the pictures alone and i must admit when we arrived it did look just like the pictures! the rooms were modern with hard wood floors and nice bathrooms. i really liked this hotel alot! the staff was courteous and helpful. my bf and i used the workout facility one morning and it was obvious that a lot of guests don't use it because the treadmill was turned off but staff was quick to turn on t.v. and all equipment. the only thing i didn't like was the continental breakfast, being from america, i am used to a completely different definition of breakfast but it was filling and i kept it moving. this is also a great location, just a couple of blocks to the beach! we were fortunate enough to see some of the air and water show and languish on the beach (in october!!!) before we sailed away on the big ship. when we return to barcelona, (and we will), this would definitely be a place to consider staying again! such a good time! also, if u get a chance take the barcelona touristic bus, it is a fabulous tour!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: spact
Reviews.Content: perfect city,perfect hotel,perfect location ,perfect breakfast ,perfect means of transport but most of all perfect price -price 50 euro(early booking -metro liacuna 5 minutes (very safe walking area ) -2 buses exactly 1 minute walking from the hotel (number 36 to go to the beach and number 14 to plaza catlunya ) both in only 10-15 minutes -1 night bus (N8) every 20 minutes all night -stop exactly outside hotel door -amazing breakfast espacially if you book it from internet (half price) -free mini shampoo-gilletes-saving foam etc. -amazing sand beach 5 minutes from the hotel -sightseeing bus stop only 1 minute from hotel tip 1 -do not hesitate to book brekfast from internet.you ii enjoy tip 2- if you are coming from airport stop to barna sants and change 2 trains to hotel .it is very easy.if you stop at passeig de gracia you ll change only 1 train but walk 10 minutes with luggage (lots of stairs)

Reviews.Title: “Great view of the Mediterranean Sea!”
Reviews.Author: Juste1
Reviews.Content: Great hotel close to the beach with a great view on the sea and a very nice typical Spanish cimetery. Walking distance to many city attraction: Olympic village, marina, boardwalk. The rooms are modern and very clean. Breakfast is very good with lots of choices. Internet is available in the main room of the lobby. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very clean. The hotel is definitely one I would recommend. If you stay at this hotel make sure you go to the “Raco de La Vila” restaurant just a few minutes’ walk from the hotel, but make sure to reserve.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Night's Sleep”
Reviews.Author: skipper123
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a quiet part of town, and was the perfect stop over before our cruise the next day. The man on reception was extremely helpful, and gave us the name and directions of a local restaurant, called Raco De La Vila which was full of locals and was excellent. The room at the hotel was clean and comfortable, with plenty of space for our many suitcases, and breakfast was self service and quite comprehensive. The bed was extremely comfortable as were the pillows, and it's one the the best night's sleep we'd experienced in a hotel. We had previously visited Barcelona, and stayed nearer to the centre of the city, but on this occasion, we decided as this was a practical choice we didn't need to be in the heart of the nightlife. It was quite a peaceful location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Korola
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, close to the beach (5-10 min walking). about 40 min walking to city center. Not very picturesque neighborhood, a bit industrial, and there is a graveyard right next to the hotel, but the place is very quiet and peaceful. The rooms are modern and very clean. That's a pity that there's no balcony in the room. Breakfast is very nice, a lot of items, delicious, but you have to get up earlier, because at 9 a.m. there a lot of people and you have to wait for clean tables.

Reviews.Title: “Would not go back”
Reviews.Author: Lazzzyboy
Reviews.Content: Was very disappointed with this hotel after reading the reviews and for a 4 Star hotel I expected alot more. The staff when checking in were not very friendly or helpful. Room was nice with a nice bathroom.(equipped with everything except conditioner. ) The room has no fridge, which if you're like me and like cold beer then definitely do not stay here! I had to go downstairs and wait each time for a waiter to show up at the bar to get ice to try cool my drinks. One time I had called the kitchen one time to ask them for ice and they charged me $3E for it. So don't order ice to your room. The breakfast compared to the other 4 star hotels we stayed in Europe was quite poor, not much variety and we had to wait for a seat to sit down in their little restaurant. The reason i choose this hotel was its proximity to Port Olympic and the Beach based on reviews from here. It wasn't as close as I thought, the location of a hotel is in a run down industrial area of Barcelona with homeless people living across the road. Also being a 4 star hotel near a beach I expected them to supply beach towels which they don't, or atleast know where to buy a beach towel from....which they don't know either. The only positive thing I have to say about this hotel is free internet and nice newly built rooms other wise a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: KonradL
Reviews.Content: Excellent value and location. New clean and friendly, close to the olympic village restaurants and beaches. Will stay there again anytime. Breakfast buffet is a very good value. Overall - a winner!

Reviews.Title: “NOT AS GOOD AS EXPECTED”
Reviews.Author: Doudouna_Antonella
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a pretty nice neighbourhood, near the beach.The hotel staff was really helpfull and welcoming.However, the room was really small but clean.Another thing we didn't like, was that there wasn't a fridge inside the room.It was hot outside and we had to buy water every hour because it had goten warm inside the room...I am sure they will take care of these aspects...

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended especially for beach but also rest of city”
Reviews.Author: weekobiela
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were both very pleasantly surprised when we arrived at the hotel ( as sometimes it is difficult to know what you are getting) We arrived quite late (about 10pm) the receptionist on duty was very pleasant and advised us of restaurants at Port Olympic where we could eat, and gave us directions. Our room was just perfect, nice decor, modern but warm, bright paintings, a view from our window of the sea to the left and the mountains to the right. To my delight there was a bath not just a shower for relaxing in after a long day out, lots of nice complimentary products such as bath foam and even razors and the towels were nice and soft. It was a 10 minute walk maximum to Port Olympic (depending on how far along you choose to walk) where there were lots of bars and restaurants, also some nice beach bars and tapas bars on the promenade leading to Port Olympic. My boyfriend and I enjoy walking and weren't in a rush to get anywhere in particular, we managed to walk the next day from the hotel to the Gothic Quarter, down Las Ramblas and back to Port Olympic. We took a lot in along the way and this suited us, though it is easy to get a Metro from near the hotel or a bus if you prefer. There is the Bus Turistic which we nearly got but then didn't, about 20 euros I think plus you can get a discount if you book at the hotel with vouchers you will find in a stand next to the lifts with lots of tourist information. I would probably recommend this if you think you will use it for a few stops, especially for Park Guell as it is on the far side of the city and once you are there there is a lot of walking to do and it is beautiful with amazing views over the whole city and ocean. I would recommend taking a picnic as you could spend all day there, there is a cafe serving snacks and beers but can get quite busy. If you don't think you will use the Bus Turistic much and don't want to spend 20 euros but want to go to Park Guell, you can get the 92 bus from the centre of town, it is 1 euro 40 each way and recommended for the uphill struggle to get there! We ended up walking back though. The restaurant in the hotel was also very nice to sit in, breakfast was great, nice fresh fruit, yogurt, eggs, breads, preserves, juice, coffee, tortilla, pastries, cheeses and cold meats. The breakfast staff were very pleasant as were the house keeping staff. There is also free internet which is very useful for making ongoing travel arrangements etc. We unfortunately didn't get the chance to use the sauna or steam room but had a look and they did look very appealing! There is a shop 2 minutes away if you are stuck for something like lady's things which I was, or water or a cold drink amongst general groceries. We didn't really use the bar or lounge at the hotel, it was nice but we preferred to go out and about to drink and eat. If we had been staying longer I think we would have used the lounge bar at some point as it was relaxed and we felt welcome. So, in conclusion - I know some reviews have said the hotel was too far from the city - not for us. We liked the fact that we could leave the city behind and in the evening enjoy our own little bit of Barcelona i.e Port Olympic, the beach bars and harbour,then walk 5 minutes to our hotel. Some reviews complained about a graveyard but I didn't even notice one and anyway, graveyards are peaceful so I don't see the problem. I would definitely definitely stay here again. I would highly recommend it to beach goers and I would highly recommend it to non beach goers because it is a lovely hotel with lovely staff and very cumfy beds! The only reason I didn't give 5 stars was because I didn't feel that there was an evening restaurant as such - but then with so many places to eat in Barcelona who cares! Plus, breakfast was great and there is a lounge menu if for any reason you can't go out at night to eat or you just fancy a snack. Also, Park Cituedella is very close and beautiful, we went rowing in the pond with the ducks and terrapins! 6 euros for half an hour and what fun, Barcelona is big and there is a lot to see but you don't have to go far from the hotel to have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Only one word for this hotel - Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: Aqueous27
Reviews.Content: Myself and my Partner stayed at the GBB Hotel 4 for 3 nights (18th - 20th August 2010) and had a fantastic stay. The reception staff were nothing but helpful and friendly with us, helping us to understand where everything was in relation to the hotel using a pocket guide map. Also, when i accidentally dropped a glass in the bathroom in the middle of the night, the evening staff were also very courtious. Our stay included breakfast which was completely worth it! I've never seen so many cakes, pastries and fresh bread. Lots of choice, cereals, yoghurt, fresh fruit and fruit juice as well as some 'hot' items like scrambled egg and mini sausages - enough to last until lunch and beyond. The hotel room was beautiful. We had a twin room with a view to the sea. The hotel is very quiet and we were not disturbed at all - got some lovely sleep after all our sight seeing and spending time on the beach. Beds made every day and towels changed every day, the housekeeping staff are lovely. Llacuna is the nearest metro stop and the hotel is about 3 blocks away, about a five minute walk. The beach is also about a five minute walk heading around the back of the Hotel and past the beautiful poblenou cemetary. Overall we loved our stay here and would stay here again and again !! I would reccomend that anyone who stays here invests in a 10 journey metro ticket. In the 3 days we were visiting, i think we made 9 journeys including a return bus journey to Parc Guell (you can use your metro ticket on the bus and train). A lot of people have commented that there are no restaurants near the hotel.... i'm sure like us, you will find somewhere to eat whilst you are out and about in Barcelona? There is a restaurant on the way to the Hotel from the metro station (right hand side) looked lovely but we never managed to eat there. At the metro stop there is also a supermarkat which, was also useful.

Reviews.Title: “one refrigerator in floor”
Reviews.Author: IranAlireza
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel from booking.com when we arrive to this hotel we asked from reception about some body to help us about our bagage and he said i am alone and no body here to help u any way, we booked triple room ocean view but we find 1 double room with not comfort extra bed by Cemetery view !!!!and we cant find any refrigerator in room, only one refrigerator in our floor and u must pay to use refrigerator. room is very small for 3 person but clean. they have 3 computer in busines center but only 1 computer worked and if u have emergency ............

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: deefletch
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here in July this year and the staff all spoke good English and were very helpful. The decor and furnishings in the hotel were lovely, there was free internet use also. Breakfasts were excellent with a huge choice of food; cereal, fresh fruit, juices, cakes, cooked food, yoghurts toast, etc. The hotel is two streets from the beach (sunbed hire is expensive, 17 euro for two beds and an umbrella). It is a quiet district, a long walk from harbour and centre of city but the buses are excellent. As is the subway (aircon in trains!) and this is cheap to use. The city tour bus is 22 euro for a days pass, a great way to see the city. Barcelona is beautiful. Next time I would go in Spring or late autumn as too hot for me to walk in high summer!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel-Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: LovelyPrissana
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent 5 nights in this beautiful hotel. Rooms are very nice, clean and well maintained. Staff were very friendly and helpful! We needed a rental car for a day and they took care everything by calling the company for us. Our flight didn't leave until late evening and they were nice to keep our luggages locked in a room for us since we had to check out around 11am. I will definitely come back and enjoy my stay with GBB.

Reviews.Title: “VERY PLEASED”
Reviews.Author: caroline222uk
Reviews.Content: Staff very helpful and courteous with good english. Breakfast good quality, variety and freshly and frequently replenished. Good size room and beds top quality , excellent nights sleep. Maid service efficient and clean. 15 mins from centre with extremely efficient air conditioned bus service - 100 metres from reception. Good local cafes and restaurant. Would definetly stay again and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended if you are looking for a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: m20jp
Reviews.Content: Since this hotel is located in the factory area, the atmosphere is a bit different from the tourist area. However, I feel safe even at night and able to walk safely to the nearest station. The hotel faces to the ocean and the graveyard. As the room I stayed was not the ocean view, I couldn’t see the ocean over the graveyard (I thought it would be beautiful), but I could see the Sagrada Familia in the distance from my room. I stayed at a tiny double room, windows are dirty, and I didn’t want to spend a long time in this room. Also, a view from my room was not very beautiful, just an unattractive residential area. I recommend you to request a room (ocean view or the other) when you check-in. Japanese tour groups also stayed at this hotel and I was assigned to the room next to one of the Japanese tour guests. Be careful when you use a bathroom since the bathroom door is a frosted glass and there is a gap around the door. The rich amenities were very helpful. There were varieties of dishes for the breakfast and I was satisfied with it. My favorites were prosciutto and salamis. Finally, as other reviewers also reported, a/c was not controllable. I tried to adjust the setting with reading a manual, but the temperature setting changed back automatically and it was very hot. As the summer approaches, a/c setting should be improved. Also, I was very uncomfortable with the strong perfume smell in my room. I was wondering if they perfume the bed sheets and covers. Since the room has poor ventilation, it would be hard for those who have sensitive nose. This is a brand new hotel, and I hope they will improve their facilities and services in the future. (June, 2010)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and great value”
Reviews.Author: crusader9872
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 9 nights recently and it was a wonderful trip helped in no small part by the hotel and its staff. The location was perfect in a nice quite area with a metro station nearby to access all that Barcelona has to offer. The staff were very friendly and could not have done more to make our stay enjoyable. We did not have breakfast in the hotel as we like to explore little cafes for this but we did eat in the restaurant in the evenings and it was of excellent quality and very reasonable. If i was to have one small issue with the hotel it is the lack of tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms but that is very minor and i would have no problem whatever in recommending Hotel 4 very highly. Richard (Ireland).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, good value and in a pretty good, but quiet, location.”
Reviews.Author: daveh104
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three very comfortable nights. The rooms are large, well decorated / fitted and very comfortable. The staff were very friendly and helpful, they gave the impression that they wanted us to enjoy our stay in Barcelona. Breakfast was good with plenty of choice; it did however get quite crowded and we felt the restaruant was very small for the size of the hotel, another coffee machine is needed! The hotel is in a pretty good location, quiet but not too far from the action. The beach is a five minute walk and a metro station 5 to 10 minutes in the other direction. Overall a great stay and would book again if we return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, dont miss the sauna!! Not so good location”
Reviews.Author: dbhgirl
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is lovely, the rooms are nice, very well decorated, you wanna decorate your house like that room!! Very modern room and bathroom. Not to mention that it is brand new. The amenities were wonderful. There is a "spa area" (sauna and steaming room) that is sooo nice and clean, I loved it ! Great for relaxing after a long day of walk around Barcelona. The staff was nice all the times even with my poor Spanish they never gave up on trying to understand what I needed. The TV has lots of channels. The only negative thing is the location. It is kind of far from everything. You are supposed to leave the subway and walk 3 blocks to get to the hotel, but I took a wrong exit on the subway and got really lost! Nobody knows that street where the hotel is!! It is incredible. So I couldnt go back because people didnt know how to help me! I had to walk 45 minutes to find the hotel again because taxis wont stop for you in the streets of Spain, (you have to call them). So get a good map and memorize the way from hotel to the subway station. I advise to get there before dark because at night it is really dark to get from the subway to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: Elaine627
Reviews.Content: Lovely, new hotel, beautiful decor, bright and airy. We were on the 6th floor with a sea view. Big room, twin beds pushed together making a very large, comfortable sleeping area. Good sized bathroom, walk-in shower, plenty of hot water and fresh white towels. Breakfast was included which had something for every taste and plenty of it. Staff all very pleasant and helpful. We had dinner in the hotel, three courses each with choice of three, wine, water and coffee for 15euros - excellent! The location is a 10 min walk from Llacuna metro through an industrial area. Not particulary pretty but didn't feel unsafe. They are doing a lot of improvements in the area. Walk from the hotel to the beach is much nicer where you will find many eating places. A stroll along the seafront to La Rambla will take about an hour. My only critisism is that breakfast finishes at 10.30 and right on the button they start to clear everything away, even the morning it was very busy and we had to queue to get a table. Maybe they could be a little more relaxed with the time. We would return to this hotel in a instant, a little out of the centre but easy access to all the attractions. Great hotel, highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “super hotel & friendly hotel staff at affordable price”
Reviews.Author: topgoon
Reviews.Content: very helpful staff who al spoke good english, good breakfast and also we tried an evening dinner instead of dinning out which was also good. it is situated in a great little town near port olimpic and if you come straight out of the hotel and walk in a straight line for about 100 metres you've got Llacuna METRO which links all the great towns and sights of Barcelona and its easy to use

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, clean, smart”
Reviews.Author: breakingnews
Reviews.Content: Would definately recommend this Hotel. Easy access to tube and great to be so near the beach and port Olympic. Breakfast was good too and staff very helpful. Only downside was the noise from the corridor when some lads came in late at night but most hotels have thin walls anyway. Free wifi is a great bonus too and our small notepad even fitted in the big safe

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel 4 Barcelona
HotelInfo.Address: Carrer Doctor Trueta, 164, 08005 Barcelona, Spain (Formerly GBB Hotel 4 Barcelona)
